case_vignette: A 63-year-old woman comes to the emergency department because of a 1-day history of progressive blurring and darkening of her vision in the right eye. Upon waking up in the morning, she suddenly started seeing multiple dark streaks. She has migraines and type 2 diabetes mellitus diagnosed at her last health maintenance examination 20 years ago. She has smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for 40 years. Her only medication is sumatriptan. Her vitals are within normal limits. Ophthalmologic examination shows visual acuity of 20/40 in the left eye and 20/100 in the right eye. The fundus is obscured and difficult to visualize on fundoscopic examination of the right eye. The red reflex is diminished on the right.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing a progressive blurring and darkening of my vision in the right eye since yesterday.
Are you experiencing any pain in the affected eye?
No, I'm not feeling any pain in the affected eye.
Have you noticed any flashes of light or floaters in your vision?
Yes, upon waking up I started seeing multiple dark streaks.
How old are you and do you have any previous history of eye problems?
I am 63 years old and I've never had any eye problems before.
Do you have a history of diabetes, hypertension, or any other chronic health conditions?
I have type 2 diabetes and I get migraines.
Have you ever had any eye surgery or injuries to your eye?
No, I've never had any eye surgery or injuries to my eye.
Do you see a shadow or curtain effect over your field of vision?
No, I don't see a shadow or curtain over my vision.
Have you experienced any recent changes in your migraine patterns or intensity?
There haven't been any recent changes in my migraine patterns or intensity.
Is the blurring and darkening in your vision constant or does it fluctuate throughout the day?
It has been progressive since it started yesterday.
Have any of your family members had similar vision problems or been diagnosed with eye conditions?
I don't have any information about my family members having similar vision problems or eye conditions.

Given the symptoms and information provided:

**Final Diagnosis:** Retinal detachment
